content:
This is a guideline to how JYSK would like to recieve photos for packaging. The photos will used to generate a Line Drawing of the product that later will be placed on packaging.

There are 4 rules that needs be followed to reach an uniformed expression on all photos:

2. Facing of the product

3. Angle of the product

4. Symmetry in the product
Make photo of product on calm and neutral background and with ok light so the product is easy to seea.

Prefered facing is to the right, but make 2 picture versions of the product :

one facing to the right - PREFERRED

one straight forward

Products should be photographed in a perspektive so shape and details of product is visible and so it is proportional correct.

Please follow below guide:

Make sure vertical lines of product is straight
When doing the photo, make sure that product doesn’t seem out of shape but has symmetry.. See below examples:
This is a guideline to how JYSK would like to recieve photos for packaging. The photos will used to generate a Line Drawing of the product that later will be placed on packaging.
There are 4 rules that needs be followed to reach an uniformed expression on all photos:
Make photo of product on calm and neutral background and with ok light so the product is easy to seea.
Prefered facing is to the right, but make 2 picture versions of the product :
one facing to the right - PREFERRED
Products should be photographed in a perspektive so shape and details of product is visible and so it is proportional correct.
Make photo with eye focus at top outer area of product.
Make sure vertical lines of product is straight
When doing the photo, make sure that product doesn’t seem out of shape but has symmetry.. See below examples:
This foot needs to face front like above so need adjustment
